How to Install xhtml-relaxng on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • xhtml-relaxng

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install xhtml-relaxng on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing xhtml-relaxng on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall xhtml-relaxng in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install xhtml-relaxng, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install xhtml-relaxng Using apt

To install xhtml-relaxng in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install xhtml-relaxng using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install xhtml-relaxng

The installation of xhtml-relaxng might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install xhtml-relaxng Using apt-get

To install xhtml-relaxng using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install xhtml-relaxng.

sudo apt-get -y install xhtml-relaxng

Install xhtml-relaxng Using Synaptic

To install xhtml-relaxng using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install xhtml-relaxng on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for xhtml-relaxng. This will display the xhtml-relaxng package in the package window, now to install xhtml-relaxng, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the xhtml-relaxng package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of xhtml-relaxng.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install xhtml-relaxng Using aptitude

To install xhtml-relaxng on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of xhtml-relaxng.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install xhtml-relaxng using the command aptitude install xhtml-relaxng.

sudo aptitude -y install xhtml-relaxng

How to Upgrade xhtml-relaxng on debian

If you want to upgrade the xhtml-relaxng package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade xhtml-relaxng using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade xhtml-relaxng to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade xhtml-relaxng.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade xhtml-relaxng sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade xhtml-relaxng

Upgrade xhtml-relaxng using Aptitude

To upgrade xhtml-relaxng using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade xhtml-relaxng.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade xhtml-relaxng

Upgrade xhtml-relaxng using Synaptic

To upgrade xhtml-relaxng using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for xhtml-relaxng, now right-click xhtml-relaxng, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade xhtml-relaxng just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall xhtml-relaxng on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall xhtml-relaxng from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just xhtml-relaxng, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove xhtml-relaxng

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of xhtml-relaxng

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of xhtml-relaxng you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge xhtml-relaxng

Remove xhtml-relaxng using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall xhtml-relaxng using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for xhtml-relaxng, right-click the xhtml-relaxng package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall xhtml-relaxng click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install xhtml-relaxng on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade xhtml-relaxng using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of xhtml-relaxng then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
